questions.question: What is the main aim of the Sewage Treatments?

choices.answer: to reduce the Biological Oxygen Demand of the sewage.
to remove as much of the suspended solids as possible of the sewage
to increase the Biological Oxygen Demand of the sewage.

questions.question: The sewage outfall is the waste water from the homes and in some cases, industries.

choices.answer: the removed from a septic system tof an underground, sealed settling tank.
a dry fully covered by a plhole where the human expose its wastes through.
a dry toilet in which vegetable waste are added to produce compost.

questions.question: Which of these is not a part of the sewage treatment?
An effluent is a discharge of solid waste

choices.answer: A treatment that separates human excreta from contact with humans
The treatment in which liquid waste is discharged
A treatment that make particles in the water stick together
The treatment to make water potable, filtered and desinfected

questions.question: A flush toilet uses a holding tank for flushing water, and water seal that prevents smells
In which environment is usually discharged the effluent?

choices.answer: The process in which water is filtered through sand
The add of chlorine-based substances to water
The waste water from homes and industries
